definition: thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal
branch/classifier for sticks, rods, pencils etc
tip/end/final stage/latter part/inessential detail/powder/dust/opera role of old man
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: For the first half of the year, complete long-term projects and tie up loose ends.
sentences.chinese: 在今年的上半年，完成长期的计划并处理好细枝末节。

sentences.english: The president doesn't need to involve herself with this kind of minutia.
sentences.chinese: 总统不需要管这种细枝末节的事。

sentences.english: The trimmings are soon forgotten in a hand-to-hand encounter for life or death.
sentences.chinese: 在徒手生死格斗中，细枝末节很快就会被忘掉。

sentences.english: Tabloid gossip derives its entertainment value from subtle suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 八卦小报费尽心思，企图从细枝末节中发现文娱价值。

sentences.english: The bill covers all of these topics, but also countless sideshows and boondoggles.
sentences.chinese: 该法案涵盖了所有的这些问题，但也有太多细枝末节。

sentences.english: But that was widely shrugged off as a minor detail.
sentences.chinese: 但是这普遍被认为是一个无需在意的细枝末节。

sentences.english: You can go back and search for details of an exchange you had months ago.
sentences.chinese: 你可以回顾几个月前的聊天记录，具体到细枝末节。

sentences.english: Mr Le Pen has again called the Nazi gas chambers "a detail of history".
sentences.chinese: 勒庞再次称纳粹毒气室是“细枝末节”。

sentences.english: the other 80% are just excess trivialities that can be ignored.
sentences.chinese: 其他80%都是可以忽略的细枝末节。

sentences.english: Your salvation lies in a moment-by-moment recounting of the minutiae.
sentences.chinese: 你的救星就是时时刻刻描述那些细枝末节。

definition: lit. chicken feathers and garlic skins (idiom)/fig. trivial (matter)
branches and knots/fig. side issue/minor peripheral problem
lit. things are not separated according to their size (idiom)/fig. to deal with any matter, regardless of its importance
just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
(idiom) take care of everything; handle everything
